text: Look alive, you little twerps.
Its theme song time.

How are we still trapped
in this never-ending loop?
There's no escape.
Hang on, kids.

What if I told you
I've been dreaming up

a brand new television
program that's
all about vegetable farming?
What?

Oh, dear, I see
where this is headed.

It's finally time for
my theme song takeover.

Hit that music like
the rain hits soil.
No, no, no, no!

(SINGING) Welcome to "Bill
Green's Farming Show," where
we learn how your veggies grow.

We'll cover eggplants,
corn, and carrots,

judge different colored
flowers on their florets.
All of the seeds!

All the world will tune in as
we dabble in some hydroponics,
study soil with mnemonics.

Life is never dull with
ladybugs for pest control.
[roar]

So what do you
think of my show?
Do you dig it?
[rimshot]
Get it?

Uh, Papa, as much as
we enjoyed your song,

I'm not sure a TV network
will find your program as,

eh, sustainable as
your farming practices.

Dad, we love ya, but I think
what Tilly is trying to say
is, your show sounds boring!

Cricket, it's not always
nice to tell the truth.
[groans]
Oh, hey, Mr. Green.

Some friends and I are
volunteering at the community
garden this weekend.

Any chance you could
tag along to offer--
It would be my honor!

Who needs their
own TV show anyway?

Um, [chuckles awkwardly]
yeah, cool.
Thanks.
